medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistently elevated serum level of prostate-specific antigen (PSA).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's PSA level was elevated for over 7 years, beginning with routine testing. Despite multiple prostate biopsies, only one biopsy revealed a tiny focus of adenocarcinoma approximately 3.5 months before this presentation, indicating a slow progression of disease.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and diverticulitis; history of partial colectomy for ruptured diverticulum 14 years earlier.
medical_history.family_history: Father had untreated prostate cancer in his 60s and died with metastatic prostate cancer 20 years later; mother had breast cancer and died at 88 of a stroke; sister had breast cancer at 39 and died 10 years later of metastatic disease.
medical_history.social_history: Married; retired from an office position; stopped smoking 30 years ago after 10 years of smoking; stopped alcohol consumption 10 years ago after moderate use; did not use illicit drugs.
